New Records: Nick Martinez's 6.44 strikeout-to-walk ratio is the best for a Reds pitcher (minimum 100 innings) since 1900.
The game was the fastest nine-inning Major League game played since Cleveland vs. Detroit finished in 1:44 on June 2, 2010.
Key Match Events: Nick Martinez pitched his first complete game in the big leagues, allowing one earned run and five hits over eight innings with no walks and three strikeouts.
Nico Hoerner led off the fifth inning with a double to left field and later scored the only run of the game on a sacrifice fly by Miguel Amaya.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Martinez expressed that winning is most important to him and he is open to any capacity that helps the team.
Interim manager Freddie Benavides praised Martinez's performance and expressed hope that Martinez would not opt out of his contract.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With a stiff wind blowing in at Wrigley Field, offense was hard to come by for both clubs.
Elly De La Cruz was thrown out at third base after attempting to stretch a double into a triple, highlighting the need for smarter baserunning by the Reds.
